intro: Microlicia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Microlicia tridentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
